canvas module¶

This module contains the canvas where the plots are drawn.

class canvas.MyCanvas(parent=None, width=6, height=8, dpi=300)¶

Bases: matplotlib.backends.backend_qt5agg.FigureCanvasQTAgg

Main class to do the drawing.

This class contains the canvas where all the graphs are displayed. Also handles events and such.

place_labels(axes, label_text, label_xy, threshold=0.0)¶

Create labels and place them.

Parameters:
  • axes (matplotlib.Axes.axes) – the axes to place the labels into.
  • label_text (iterable) – the text for the labels
  • label_xy (iterable) – the position where the labels should be.
  • threshold (float) – if the maximum point is lower than this, no label is placed.
plotCalor(widget)¶

Plot calorimetry fit.

This function plots all the information for a caloriemtry fit. It takes the data available from the internal data variable and plots it. The procedure is that it divides the figure in three parts. On top the experimental data, corresponding fit and calculated concentrations are plotted. In the middle, the residuals are plotted. On the bottom, one single plot with the variation of the residuals is displayed.

Parameters:widget (calorwidget.CalorWidget) – The calorimetry data widget
plotEmf(widgets)¶

Plot potentiometry fit data.

This function plots all the information for a potentiometry fit. It takes the data available from the internal data variable and plots it. The procedure is that it divides the figure in three parts. On top the experimental data, corresponding fit and calculated concentrations are plotted. In the middle, the residuals are plotted. On the bottom, one single plot with the variation of the residuals is displayed.

Parameters:widgets (sequence) – sequence of apes.EmfWidget type.
Raises:ValueError – if any of the widgets if of the wrong type.
plotSpectr()¶

Plot all the information for a spectrometry fit.

It takes the data available from the internal data variable and plots it. The procedure is that it divides the figure in four parts. On top the experimental data, corresponding fit and calculated concentrations are plotted. In the middle, the residuals are plotted. On the bottom left, the fit spectra are shown and on bottom right variation of the residuals is displayed.

style(N=None, withfill=False)¶

Generate style data.

This function returns a generator which returns a dict to be plugged into the matplotlib.pyplot.plot() function.

The styles available are the following:

  • style 1 Solid line
  • style 2 solid line
  • style 3 Solid line
  • style 4 solid line
Parameters:N (int) – The number of style entries to be generated. If it is None then an infinite generator will be returned.
Returns:
a two-element tuple in which the first element is a
generator that returns a dict that contains the style for the lineplot; the second element is either None or another dict with the style for the plotfill.
Return type:tuple
